original_title: President returns to SL after two-day official visit to India
original_body_lines: President Ranil Wickremesinghe arrived in the island on Friday (21) night after completing his two-day official visit to India.
A spokesman of the Katunayake Bandaranaike International Airport stated that the President and his delegation arrived in the island at about 11.30 last night.
The President left for India the day before yesterday, to take on an official visit, upon an invitation of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
During his visit, President Ranil Wickremesinghe met with the Prime Minister of India, the President and other top level officials, and discussed matters important to both countries.
The President also met and had a discussion with the founder of Adani Group in India, Gautam Adani.
The President also met Indian Foreign Secretary Vinay Mohan Kwatra last evening.
The Indian Foreign Secretary commented on the agreements reached by Sri Lanka and India.
This is the first visit to India made by President Wickremesinghe after assuming the office of President.
Cabinet approval given for agreement to further develop Trincomalee – Ali Sabry
“We supported Ranil to stabilize the economy and establish democracy.” – SLPP General Secretary
